Tyrese Maxey was selected 21st overall by the Philadelphia 76ers in the 2020 NBA Draft
Tyrese Maxey played college basketball at the University of Kentucky under coach John Calipari

Tyrese Maxey was a McDonald's All-American in high school
Tyrese Maxey won a gold medal with Team USA at the 2018 FIBA Under-17 Basketball World Cup
In college, Tyrese Maxey averaged 14.0 points per game as a freshman at Kentucky
Tyrese Maxey recorded his first career triple-double in 2024 with 50 points, 7 rebounds, and 5 assists
Tyrese Maxey was named SEC Freshman of the Week three times during his college career
Tyrese Maxey's father played college basketball at Washington State
In high school, Tyrese Maxey was a five-star recruit and ranked as the #13 player in the 2019 class
Tyrese Maxey scored 30+ points in 15 games during the 2023-24 season
Tyrese Maxey was named the NBA's Most Improved Player runner-up in 2024
Tyrese Maxey set a 76ers franchise record for most three-pointers made in a single game (11)
Tyrese Maxey was born on November 4, 2000, in Dallas, Texas
Tyrese Maxey played in the 2020 McDonald's All-American Game alongside Anthony Edwards
In his sophomore NBA season, Tyrese Maxey improved his scoring average from 8.0 to 17.5 points per game
Tyrese Maxey was named to the All-SEC Second Team in his only college season
Tyrese Maxey recorded a career-high 12 assists in a game against the Charlotte Hornets
Tyrese Maxey's jersey number 0 represents starting from nothing and building his way up
Tyrese Maxey was the first player in 76ers history to score 50+ points in a game before turning 24
Tyrese Maxey shot 43.4% from three-point range during the 2023-24 season
Tyrese Maxey was named Eastern Conference Player of the Week in March 2024
Tyrese Maxey played high school basketball at South Garland High School in Garland, Texas
Tyrese Maxey was a consensus five-star recruit and ranked #1 point guard in Texas
Tyrese Maxey scored 20+ points in 47 games during the 2023-24 regular season
Tyrese Maxey was named to the NBA All-Star Game for the first time in 2024
Tyrese Maxey's career-high in rebounds is 11, achieved against the Boston Celtics
Tyrese Maxey was the youngest player in 76ers history to score 50 points in a game
